inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Only obese subjects will be selected given that they are the highest risk group of developing insulin resistance and Type II Diabetes

inclusion.criterion: 12- 18 years regardless of gender, race or economic circumstance
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Pre diabetes/high risk of diabetes using criteria of HbA1C between 5.7 - 6.4%
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: 25-OH vitamin D level less than 20 ng/ml (50 nmol/liter)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects must be willing to comply with study protocol requirements
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Treatment on medication known to effect vitamin D, calcium and glucose metabolism
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: such as glucocorticoids, thiazolidinediones, metformin, anticonvulsants metabolized through cytochrome P-450 (phenytoin, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, sodium valproate)

exclusion.criterion: Subjects will be excluded from the study if they have taken any form of vitamin D supplementation greater than 400 IU daily in the preceding 3 months
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Significant psychiatric illness: schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, active substance abuse, and uncontrolled major depression.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 37-year-old woman who came to the clinic for a routine Pap smear. The test revealed stage 1B of cervical cancer.
